intro: Cyrtandra discors, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra discors plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian forests.
